title: ISic000330. Funerary inscription for Aphrodito, a mime actress
body:
Facsimile Images

1DMS
2APHRODITO
3MIMASivy-leafVIXivy-leaf
4ANNivy-leafXXXXivy-leaf
5EUTYCHUSivy-leafCON- ivy-leaf
6IUGIivy-leafMERENT͡IF

Apparatus criticus

Text based on autopsy

English translation

Sacred to the spirits of the underworld. Aphrodito the mime lived for 40 years. Eutychus (set this up) for his deserving wife.

Italian translation

Consacrato agli Dei Mani. La mima Aphrodito visse 40 anni. Eutychus (lo costruì) per la meritevole moglie.

commentary

Aphrodito (LGPN V3A: 37802) is a rare female name, most commonly found in northern Greece / Macedonia. Mimas copies the Greek word μιμάς designating a mime actor. Mime, a highly successful form of popular, comic drama, had its first real success in fifth-century BC Sicily, and was very popular in Rome and Italy throughout the later Republic and Imperial period. Ancient mime has however only come down to us in fragments. The genre flourished in the Hellenistic east also, and Aphrodito’s name suggests that she may have come from the eastern Mediterranean to practice her art in Sicily and Italy.

For online Italian edition see EpiCUM420

bibliography

  • 10.7046 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000589
  • 51 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
  • Manganaro 1988 59 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001427
